title: Hindustani language
summary: Hindustani (/ˌhɪndʊˈstɑːni/; Devanagari: हिन्दुस्तानी,[1][lower-alpha 2] Hindustānī, / Perso-Arabic:[a] ہندوستانی‎, Hindūstānī, lit. 'of Hindustan')[10][3][4] is the lingua franca of Northern India and Pakistan;[11][12] in linguistics and some other contexts, it is also known as  Hindi–Urdu,[13][14][15] (Devanagari: हिंदी-उर्दू,[16] Perso-Arabic: ہندی-اردو‎).[10]
